page.title: 01North Dorset Scene
page.content: The north of Dorset is a place of quiet beauty, being close enough to main roads for convenience and well served by many minor roads, all kept in a good state of repair.The geology of the area dictates the main ocupations.Heavy day soil ensures ample water supply and lush grass for dairy and store cattle.A ridge of broken limestone provides ideal grazing conditions for breeding and raising horses.Many famous racehorses started life on the fields around Sandley Bugley and langham.The river Stour winds its way along a wide flood plain to the east of the ridge,creating the scenery which delights artists and anglers.It is known as 'Constable country' a reference to that famous artist's paintings of our riverside vistas in the early nineteenth century.
